page.title: 05 DAIRY FARM
page.content: {Mr. and Mrs.McClean}and their son {Brian,}run a dairy farm at{Culkeeran, between{Dungannon and Moy.}Their home, a new two storey house, is known as Culkeeran House and is a replacement for an older house. Mr. McClean has a herd of{Friesian cows,44 of them at the moment,and they are milked twice a day,at{7.30a.m. and {5.30p.m.,seven days per week.}The {milking parlour}is a{herring-bone}one, holding 10 cows at a time,5 on each side. The cows stand on raised platforms so that the farmer can reach the cows' udders easily.Five cows are milked at a time,while the other five are being prepared.Udders are washed and some milk drawn off by hand from each teat before the clusters are put on. A good cow at one milking would give{3 gallons}of milk. .
